intro: Chamaenerion caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces clusters of pink to reddish-purple flowers in the summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture. Chamaenerion caucasicum is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants.
